boardgame.name: Book of the Dragons
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Despite the title, Book of the Dragons presents a variety of options for players (including two types of dragons). The emphasis is on "ready for the table", drop in player character classes and monsters.

boardgame.name: Sixty Feet Under
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Edgewatch agents follow up on a lead in Absalom's financial hub, where they unravel a series of clues to determine the target of an impending bank robbery and put a stop to the crime before it occurs. The robbery turns out to be just one piece to a much larger puzzle though—after the heroes investigate the bank robbers' slummy thief den, the trail ultimately leads them into the city's expansive network of underground catacombs, where the agents infiltrate and disband one of Absalom's most vicious murder cults.

"Sixty Feet Under" is a Pathfinder adventure for four 4th- or 5th-level characters. This adventure continues the Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path, a six-part monthly campaign in which the players take on the role of city watch officers doling out justice to Absalom's most nefarious criminal elements. This adventure also includes new rules and details about Golarion's mystical subcontinent of Vudra, the various guard factions within Absalom, and a slew of new monsters.

boardgame.name: dAVe - A Generic RPG System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

First of all, please note that this is a game for players looking for more of a role-play than roll-play experience.

This RPG system is designed to enable Games Masters and Players alike to create a fast-pulsed gaming experience incorporating tense high adventure in any type of suitable setting and Genre: Action/Adventure, Horror, Supernatural, etc.

It takes its inspiration from many sources.

This game system suits absolutely any timeline whatsoever, from Fantasy through Earth Historical, to Sci-Fi. The Player Characters are the Heroes of their age, striving to defeat the ubiquitous forces of evil.

The dice type used is the 'average' dice, referred to as dAVe.

boardgame.name: Scientists & Sorcerers
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You are a scientist. Or maybe you are a sorcerer. Due to a scientific mishap, or a magical mishap but most likely both, a world of science has merged with one of magic. Both magic and science work, though the effects of each discipline seem to be changed from what users of either remember. Magic and technology are running riot and the world needs both scientists and sorcerers to work together.

To play the game you need some six-sided dice (d6) and pen and paper. The rules as suggested are only suggestions; you can add more as needed.

This is a hack of Laser & Feelings by John Harper and is licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 3.0 liscense. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/us/

boardgame.name: Arms & Influence
boardgame.description:
Arms & Influence is a political strategy card game that puts you and 3 others in a contest to build the world’s most dominant power. Players build a social pyramid and attempt to advance their society to prominence by achieving 7 Victory Points.

On their turn, players choose a total of 2 cards from the Society or Action deck. The Society deck consists of Leaders and Populations; the Action deck has everything else: Advancements, Competitions and Actions.

Once they select their cards, they must take 2 actions. Using a card consists of a turn. If they cannot make a move, they must discard as an action.

With populations, players build their social pyramid in an attempt to have 5 populations. Once achieved they can elect a leader.

Each population gives players one of 4 resources: Military Strength, Equality, Espionage, and Production.

They then use these resources to obtain Advancements such as "Man on Mars", "Nuclear Submarine" etc. (worth one Victory Point). Each which require a combination of 4 resources shown on the card.

Players strategically modify their pyramid, elect new leaders, to obtain new Advancements.

In addition to Advancements, players can earn victory points by winning a Competition. When a competition is played, players compete to have the most resource of a given type by the end of the turn.

The road to victory will not be easy, as players will use Action cards to disrupt each other's rise to power.

The first player to 7 Victory Points wins the game.

-description from designer

listing.notes: Includes "Revolt!" Expansion Shipping via Mondial Relay only (Belgium, Luxembourg, Spain, Germany, Austria, Portugal, Italy, Netherland) Please contact me for shipping quote before placing an order.

boardgame.name: Daemon's Blood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A generic scenario for any Fantasy genre RPG

A small scenario concerning the disappearance of the son of a local town elder. Obviously not all is as it seems.

boardgame.name: Time~Spiral (dAVe)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the first Setting for the dAVe RPG system.

The Player Character's are members of an Agency dedicated to protecting humanity throughout time and space from an aggressive alien race.

User summary:

This is a revised version of Time~Spiral.

boardgame.name: See You in Hell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A brutal tabletop RPG about tough heroes, who stop an infernal invasion.

About the Game

Using these rules, you and your friends can tell an adventurous story about the near future full of explosions and shooting, which lasts for about two or three hours without any preparation. It will resemble brutal first-person shooter video games. The game ends with an epic boss fight. The heroes either bring the villain down or go straight into the cauldrons of the Dimension-66 yourselves.

boardgame.name: Map of Fortunes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A DUET ADVENTURE FOR PCS OF LEVELS 5-7

Trust no one and risk it all for a chance at a great (but potentially deadly) reward!

In the foothills of the Cienne Mountains, the party is tasked with recovering merchants who were kidnapped by a band of centaurs.

After returning the merchants to safety in the trading hub of Swinthorn, a local treasure hunter learns of their brave deeds and requests they assist him on a quest of his own.

With the help of a mysterious, magical map, he leads the party to a hidden mountain cave that holds buried treasure and more.

But be on guard. The southern Ciennes can be quite dangerous, especially when one is keeping somewhat…unsavory company.

WHAT’S INCLUDED WITH THE ADVENTURE PDF:
This one-shot adventure includes:

two unique NPCs
two new creatures
four new magic items
a detailed map of Kao Canyon
and a GM's and player's version of the magical treasure map.


If you enjoy the tension between luck and misfortune—and have a healthy thirst for treasure—Map of Fortunes is the adventure for you!

boardgame.name: 100 Roaring Twenties Bystanders 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent(?) bystanders that are perfect for a Roaring Twenties rpg campaign setting. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 Roaring Twenties Bystanders 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent(?) bystanders that are perfect for a Roaring Twenties rpg campaign setting. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 Roaring Twenties Bystanders 12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent(?) bystanders that are perfect for a Roaring Twenties rpg campaign setting. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: Magefall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the lands of Havvengarde! A setting guide for the Oldegrave RPG that you can truly make your own. A dangerous and magical land bordered by hostile kingdoms where adventure is around every corner.

Two new rules chapters one with several new ancestry-based Archetypes (Dwarf, Elf & Halfling) and one with rules for sea adventures.

Explore the lands of Yoranthia today!

boardgame.name: 100 Roaring Twenties Bystanders 13
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent(?) bystanders that are perfect for a Roaring Twenties rpg campaign setting. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: Vargokka Coast
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You touch down in an open field roughly 70 kilometers from the nearest settlement. As the ship’s engines start to settle and cool your trust utility bot waddles out of the cargo hold. Lights flicker on and off the bot’s front interface panel as your metallic companion begins to analyze the surroundings. With tall green grass, blue skies, and a breathable atmosphere this place feels quite a bit like your home world...

Suddenly the utility bot’s alarm system breaks your concentration. Looking up you see a trio of fanged beasts approaching from the nearby hills. Looking something like a cross between a scaly lizard and an overgrown wolf these creatures are obviously predatory. The biggest one in the front starts to snarl as you reach for your blaster...

This role playing game supplement contains an overland hex map of a coastal region that is suitable for star faring campaign settings. The map has commonly recognized earth tones and the detailed entries describe a world that is very Earth like in nature, though hot and harsh in places. Each hex on the map represents 10 kilometers and there are 15 numbered areas on the map total. Each of the numbered areas contains details that help the Game Master (GM) plot out a potential adventure, dangerous encounter, or friendly settlement or space port. The GM is welcome to further add on to the location with additional encounters, events, or important locations if they so wish.

The detailed map entries are written in a manner that allows the product to be as game system/edition generic as possible. The flavor is that of typical space opera variety, allowing you to add or remove as much of a “space fantasy” flavor as you need. As discussed prior, all the important bits are kept to one sheet of paper, allowing you to print off only that if you wish and also allowing you to quickly reference locations without having to flip through a bunch of pages. An additional version of the map is provided as well. This version lacks the numbered locations and the descriptions, giving the GM something to print if they wish to present to the player characters. The characters can use this map to keep track of where they have been and where they might be going (or wishing to explore).

boardgame.name: Pirates Beyond Time!: Assault on the Mithral Fortress (Savage Worlds)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Assault on the Mithral Fortress Continues the adventure that began in Pirates Beyond Time!

The heroes must once again contend with the time-travelling crimes of Captain Aetherblade.

boardgame.name: Algarthia Wastes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The hydraulics of the ship’s boarding ramp hiss and fume as the base of the ramp settles into the dirt of the planet’s surface. Climbing down your enviro-suit is hit with the unforgiving heat of the Algarthia Wastes, causing the temperature regulators to immediately kick in. Good thing you recently recharged the suit’s power cells…
Upon exiting the ship you begin to scan the area around you. Prickly cacti and gnarled, withered vegetation add a splash of dull green against the browns, reds, and yellows of the barren landscape. Your trusty utility bot follows slowly, seemingly hesitant for fear of overheating. You hope your employer was right about the old freighter wreckage being nearby...

This role playing game supplement contains an overland hex map of a ruined wasteland region that is suitable for star faring campaign settings. The map has commonly recognized earth tones and the detailed entries describe a world that is very brutal and unforgiving. Each hex on the map represents 10 kilometers and there are 18 numbered areas on the map total. Each of the numbered areas contains details that help the Game Master (GM) plot out a potential adventure, dangerous encounter, or friendly settlement or space port. The GM is welcome to further add on to the location with additional encounters, events, or important locations if they so wish.

After the main page you will find a bonus encounter chart. The GM should use this chart any time the characters are exploring unmarked locations on the map and the action is starting to get dull.

Two additional versions of the map are provided. One version lacks the numbered locations and the descriptions, giving the GM something to print if they wish to present to the player characters. The characters can use this map to keep track of where they have been and where they might be going (or wishing to explore). The second version adds extra blank marker circles (in a pinkish tone) to allow the GM to add some of their own points of interest to the map.

The detailed map entries are written in a manner that allows the product to be as game system/edition generic as possible. The flavor is that of typical space opera variety, allowing you to add or remove as much of a “space fantasy” flavor as you need. As discussed prior, all the important bits are kept to one sheet of paper, allowing you to print off only that if you wish and also allowing you to quickly reference locations without having to flip through a bunch of pages.

boardgame.name: Icorja Marshlands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You gulp a little as you feel your ship sinking a bit into the marshy sludge. Though this was the best landing spot you could find you really shouldn’t stay long. Looking up at the sun starting to set in the distance you have a second reason beyond your sinking ship… the night time predators of the Icorja coastal marsh can be rather unpleasant to deal with.
Before you can leave, however, you’ve got a task to do. You’ve been instructed to find the remains of an ancient alien warp gate and then report back to your employer. Already behind on this task you realize that you can’t wait until morning. As you turn back towards your ship you signal your cockpit bot to open the cargo hold door. The terrain is too flooded and far too dangerous to make this trek on foot or even with the aid of your jet pack. Fortunately you have a trusty hover sled with a powerful set of flood lights.

This role playing game supplement contains an overland hex map of a semi-flooded marshy coastal region that is suitable for star faring campaign settings. The map has commonly recognized earth tones and the detailed entries describe a world that is lush but sometimes quite bizarre. Each hex on the map represents 10 kilometers and there are 17 numbered areas on the map total. Each of the numbered areas contains details that help the Game Master (GM) plot out a potential adventure, dangerous encounter, or friendly settlement or space port. The GM is welcome to further add on to the location with additional encounters, events, or important locations if they so wish.

After the main page you will find two bonus encounter charts. One is for land encounters and the other for aquatic encounters. The GM should use this chart any time the characters are exploring unmarked locations on the map and the action is starting to get dull.

Two additional versions of the map are provided. One version lacks the numbered locations and the descriptions, giving the GM something to print if they wish to present to the player characters. The characters can use this map to keep track of where they have been and where they might be going (or wishing to explore). The second version adds extra blank marker circles (in a pinkish tone) to allow the GM to add some of their own points of interest to the map.

The detailed map entries are written in a manner that allows the product to be as game system/edition generic as possible. The flavor is that of typical space opera variety, allowing you to add or remove as much of a “space fantasy” flavor as you need. As discussed prior, all the important bits are kept to one sheet of paper, allowing you to print off only that if you wish and also allowing you to quickly reference locations without having to flip through a bunch of pages.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 20
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 21
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: The Fate of Inglemia (PF2)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Strategic Campaign outline features a Very High Magic setting for Very High Level characters. It is designed to allow the characters to alter events on a world shattering level. Incorporating elements of the Elemental Dimension of Magic, Inglemia goes back to the Prime Material roots of the eternal conflict between the Jeshatan and the magic hating Knah'tan.

Includes: 197 Spells, 45 NPC Templates, 11 Exotic Materials, 20+ Unique Devices, 7 Gods, 26 Unique Aspects, 20 Noble Houses, 10 Secret Societies, 12 Kingdoms, Self Replicating Runes, Mirror Tubes, and 5 Strategic Session Summaries!

Batteries not included.

boardgame.name: 50 Scoundrels 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Thieves, looters, brigands, robbers, cutthroats, hired blades, vultures among men… all of them scoundrels. A staple of the fantasy genre, especially gritty urban fantasy settings, these lowlife dogs often go nameless and lacking in detail. Not anymore!

This list offers 50 different scoundrels that are richly detailed– from name and a wee bit about them to what they are wearing, what they are armed with, and what goods they might be carrying on their person.

boardgame.name: 8 Lives: Cats of San Jenaro
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

8 Lives is the ninth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements."

It's about... cats. Kind of. Look it's weird. It's our BIGGEST zine, clocking in at a whopping 44 pages.
This book includes:

The Cat People: A whole clade of new monsters. Cat people. You've been warned.
A Cat-Alogue of Cats: Other monsters, fun takes on myths and legends about cats, and... weirder stuff.
Cat Myth Job Generator: Using cat-based mythology to generate random jobs for #iHunt.
Why Do Cats Sleep in the Sunshine: This is a strange little Fate hack that helps you build liminal spaces in your stories using... your phone's autocorrect? It's just strange and you're gonna have to take my word for it.
LOLKATZ: A new kink of #iHunter. They're internet trolls who learned the errors of their ways and decided to use their powers for awesome.
The Cats of San Jenaro: A WHOLE DAMN GAME about the magical cats of San Jenaro. This is a micro game written by friend of Machine Age Kenneth Rountree, originally released for the San Jenaro Short Games Digest (which you should read!) featuring art from Dyer Rose. We got the rights to publish this one and give it a whole new snazzy #iHunt-friendly layout.

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 19
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. Though perfect for various modern settings (crime, drama, supers, etc.) this could also be used for generating survivors for post apocalypse or zombie outbreak settings. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.

boardgame.name: 100 Blue Collar Workers 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different blue collar workers that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 100 Blue Collar Workers 9
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different blue collar workers that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V08.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V09.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: An Average Parking Garage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Garaids Parking. Garaids Parking is a parking garage that has a first floor entrance floorplan and a repeating floorplan that allow you to make the parking garage as tall as you would like. This means that it can be used as a free standing city parking garage or a parking garage attached to an office or apartment building.

This floorplan is presented in both an 8 1/2"x11" format for folks who want an overview and also in 36”x48” where one inch=5 feet. Layers are also included that allow you to turn on and off hexes, squares, labels, furniture and even walls. The floor plans are presented on white sheets for ease of printing.

boardgame.name: Shehkuh
boardgame.description:
Hexagonal cards with seven different faces are drawn at random or traded with opponents to build patterns. Each player tries to collect the cards necessary to build their secret pattern consisting of initially two, then three, four, five and finally six cards. The first player to build their six-card pattern wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: An Average Brick Warehouse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Casso Holding. This 24’ x36’ single story floor plan has two bathrooms, a storage room, office space and conference space in addition to the substantial warehouse floor. This building could be used as a traditional brick warehouse or could be used a business such as a granite/marble dealer, appliance showroom, etc.

This floorplan is presented in both an 8 1/2"x11" format for folks who want an overview and also in 24”x36” where one inch=5 feet. Layers are also included that allow you to turn on and off hexes, squares, labels, furniture and even walls. The floor plans are presented on white sheets for ease of printing.

boardgame.name: An Average Retro Movie Theater
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The Screening Room, a retro two-screen movie theater. This retro movie theater would have been at home in any town during the 80s. The floor plan boasts two screens with seating for close to 100 in each screening area. It has a small consession area as well as a lobby with a ticket booth right out front, a scattering of seating and a few video games.

This is also a great modern location that can serve as an artsy theater showing foreign films, an old budget theater showing second run movies or a theater in a small town showing first run movies.

This floorplan is presented in both an 8 1/2"x11" format for folks who want an overview and also at 24"x 36" where one inch=5 feet. Layers are also included that allow you to turn on and off hexes, squares, labels, furniture and even walls in both the overview and scale floorplans.

boardgame.name: An Average Garage and Gas Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This floorplan is a classic small service station with a couple of service bays, four gas pumps, bathrooms and a small sales area. This will fit into any small town throughout the United States from the late 70's/ early 80's to today.

This floorplan is presented in both an 8 1/2"x11" format for folks who want an overview and also in 24"x 18" where one inch=5 feet. Layers are also included that allow you to turn on and off hexes, squares, labels, furniture and even walls.

boardgame.name: Talos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In early 2019, the first in a line of new automated guardians was previewed by Pars Tech subsidiary, Puissant Systems. Dubbed Talos, these new automated guardians contain rudimentary artificial intelligence and exceptional dexterity. These robots are designed to augment the military and law enforcement, by serving in dangerous locations where the possibility of the loss of human life is strong. Initial tests are ongoing and the hope is these automated guardians will be released for use in the field in the next five to seven years.

The Truth

Pussiant Systems has been testing Talos for the last couple years against FARC rebels in Columbia, Mexican drug cartels, and Boko Haram in Northern Nigeria. The androids have performed well, but their aggression and singlemindedness in achieving their assigned goals have led to a large number of civilian casualties and the incredibly brutal deaths of their assigned targets.

What is Talos?

Talos is a short supplement for Olympus Inc that provides variations of a single new IMB in the form of several different Talos models such as the Talos-Elete Soldier and the Talos-Heavy Weapons model. In addition, play an Awakened Talos using this new bloodline complete with new Racial Edges and Hindrances . To introduce Talos to your players, this supplement includes a short adventure with plenty of action.

boardgame.name: A Specter of Nectar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are rumors on the street of tainted Neo-Nectar that is killing drones. This has drawn the attention of someone who has contracted with your shadow to look into it.

What is going on and will you be able to stop whomever is behind it before more drones die?

A Spectre of Nectar is an adventure suitable for Seasoned heroes. It has been designed for a single session, making it ideal for a one shot home game or convention event.

boardgame.name: The Pelion Report
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

He is a specter in the Awakened community. No one knows his real name, and some say he is so old that he doesn’t have one. His other handle is Godslayer, due to his propensity for killing IMBs and members of the Awakened com­munity. He is a rail thin Protean with long white hair, alabaster skin, and violet eyes who appears to be in his mid-20s. He is always immaculately dressed in the latest high-end male fashion. He is Sanction.

Sanction is just one of the many NPCs you’ll meet in The Pelion Report, the second setting book for Olympus Inc. In the Pelion Report, you will encounter an expanded world with new bloodlines, creatures and corporations to weave into your adventures.

In the Pelion Report you will find new:

Bloodlines and Races
Corporations
Edges/Hindrances
Weapons
IMBs
Slosi
Rules for Working with Orichalcum

boardgame.name: Tithe barns (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
“ ‘Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this,’ says the Lord Almighty, ‘and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that you will not have room enough for it.’ ”(Malachi 3:10)

Get the majority around the tithe barns and earn special points, farmers and barns around the tithe barn will give you additional points.

boardgame.name: Apothecaries (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Apotheken (Fan-Erweiterung für Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
As a result of a recent plague, apothecaries have arrived and been set up within the cities of Carcassonne. These apothecaries rely on the surrounding countryside for supplies of particular herbs, to be distributed to the population, and to the alchemists, who use the herbs’ strange properties for experiments of their own…

Deploy your followers as alchemist on an apothecary, collect herbs and see how alchemy works. Maybe you earn points or you can move your follower to another feature or or or ...

boardgame.name: Guardians of Vorin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vorin is a one page scenario, which means it’s a world built to be used for Role-Playing Games (RPG) written in one single page. To play you’ll need to choose a high-fantasy RPG system, one player to be the Game Master (GM) and 2 to 5 players to play the roles of the characters, known as the Playable Characters (PC).

Vorin is a magical tree that gives life to the whole existence of two worlds, the Overworld and the Underworld. The Overworld is full of life and joy while the Underworld is destined to be used as the penitence for those who get banned from the Overworld.

The tree’s magical fruits are enough to empower a single being beyond the limits of existence itself and for this reason they are guarded very strictly but maybe this power is close to be endangered.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Ath – Cité des Géants
boardgame.description:
Official Monopoly game for the City of Ath in Belgium.

Properties include La Jardinerie de Beloeil, Chez Pauchea, Le Drink des Primeveres, La Jeune Chambre D'Ath, and Chez Loiselet.


La ville d’Ath est attestée depuis le Moyen-Age.
En 1166, le comte du Hainaut Baudouin IV fait construire un puissant donjon, la tour Burbant, au confluent des Dendres orientale et occidentale.
Peu à peu, une cité se crée et se développe.
L’église Saint-Julien avec son clocher caractéristique est édifiée au début du 15ème siècle.
L’hôtel de ville baroque remonte au règne des Archiducs Albert et Isabelle.
Enfin, au milieu du 17ème siècle, le maréchal Vauban fortifie la cité et en fait une des plus belles place-fortes d’Europe.

Mais aujourd’hui, ce sont des personnages gigantesques qui font la renommée d’Ath. Goliath et son épouse, et tous leurs congénères, sont les emblèmes de la Ducasse, reconnue chef-d’œuvre de l’humanité par l’Unesco.
Chaque année, le quatrième week-end d’Août, des milliers de visiteurs se donnent rendez-vous à Ath pour vibrer au rythme des Géants.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Dream Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dream Engine

Four colorful crystalline structures sit upon pedestals, power being drawn via specialized tubes to power this gigantic machine. Gears whirl and grind as switches are flipped, releasing colorful gases below the main platform of the machine.

The heart of the machine sits at the top of a set of stairs, strange alien ciphers carved into it’s base. A large hologram of the world spins slowly in it’s center as a grid system layered above attends to unknown activities.

Adventure Seed

One month ago the nightmares started, at first it was only the village’s children who were effected. They had trouble sleeping and would always wake crying, claiming to be tormented by horrific, deformed creatures.

If it was only one or two of them this could have been claimed to be coincidence. However night after night this occurred to each and every child of the village.

The healer of the village at first thought this could perhaps be some type of fever affecting the young but no herbal medicines had any effect on fighting off the nightmares. When help was finally sought from the nearest city, the reply was shocking.

This was not some disease afflicting just the children of this small village but something greater that was afflicting all the children of the kingdom. Soon after this, adults began experiencing these nightmares too.

Now that everyone in the kingdom is being effected by these night terrors, you’ve been put in contact with a strange wizard who will help you track down the source of this affliction and end it before people start getting hurt due to accidents caused by lack of sleep, or before anything else more malicious occurs.

The wizard explains that he believes dreams are fundamentally connected to the divine, he thinks that dreams come from a demi-plane which he seems to have mapped.

He’s able to create a portal to allow you through to this demi-plane to deal with whatever is corrupting the realm but he will be required to stay behind and maintain the portal, for if the portal was to close you may be trapped in a realm of constantly shifting reality, never to return.

When you arrive you notice shifting shadows deep below the platform where you stand and small tendrils of ebony vapor entering the holographic world in front of you. When you get closer a shadowy apparition coalesces in order to stop your advance, tormenting you with horrible visions.

What’s going on? An evil entity has made it’s way into the realm of dreams corrupting the dreams of those on the material realm to weaken the people for a greater threat that is still yet to reveal itself from the shadows.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Tezald
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in the forested ruins of this town lies a workshop, its walls so thick few sounds can escape. Blood stains its floors and cells littered with soiled straw wait, empty. Cadavers are arrayed on workbenches before a glowing, red machine.

Two hidden exits lead outside, one through an old basement and another through a small home above. Stores walls have collapsed now covered with lichen and flowers.

boardgame.name: Peaks of Dhar'Thane
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in this forested town lies a workshop, its walls so thick few sounds can escape. Blood stains its floors and cells littered with soiled straw wait, empty. Cadavers are arrayed on workbenches before a glowing, red machine.

Two hidden exits lead outside, one through an old basement that is now being used for wine storage and another through a small home above.

Stores with lichen covered walls sell goods, mingling with homes and consultancies.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Dhar'Thane
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Carved deep into this abandoned city’s cliff lies a workshop, its walls so thick few sounds can escape. Blood stains its floors and cells littered with soiled straw wait, empty. Cadavers are arrayed on workbenches before a glowing, red machine.

Two hidden exits lead outside, where gargoyles leer down at snow covered valley far below.

Strong winds whistle through the parapet above, screaming around toppled chimneys and down narrow alleyways. Stores walls have collapsed now covered with lichen and flowers.

boardgame.name: Fungal Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Winding caverns have been carved away over the eons by tricking rivulets which funnel into the depths. Debris and muddy grounds have coalesced here with the carcasses of creatures feeding the large glowing fungus and undergrowth that has spread through the depths.

Stone bridges span the small streams which now meander ever deeper and large stone chambers hold lairs for the foul entities that call this place home.

Adventure Seed

A strange rot has infested the local farms, destroying vegetable produce and injuring those living who breath its spores. It was first noticed one month ago, when local hunters reported strange, small brown mushrooms with bio-luminescence and roots like veins. They appeared to be growing out of the entrances of caverns, leading to vast networks which run beneath the entire region…

Since then the rot has spewed fourth, contaminating the farms and forests above. The locals have tried multiple methods of cleansing it, but the infestation resists; threatening starvation.

You’ve been tasked to venture into the vast network of caverns to find its source, and perhaps, a solution.

What’s happening? Known for their amazing selection of exotic fungus, mountain dwarves export their mushrooms to the kingdoms of man. When a strange rot took hold within their growth tunnels, everything changed.

They tried everything they could think of to purge the rot, but none succeeded and the growth continued to spread throughout the underground network. Realizing that their efforts to contain the deadly infestation had failed, they sealed the contaminated tunnels so their city could survive.

Unknown to them, the mass continued to grow beneath their city, and sought other outlets.

The heart of this plague is a being who embodies living rot. Dark and twisting veins tie together carcasses of the dead, spreading spores and nutrients for its parasitic growths. Smaller creatures have broken off from it, wandering the tunnels and waiting for other living beings to incorporate into their own, rotting forms.

If one were to destroy the original, largest entity, perhaps the network of fungi would, too, fade…

boardgame.name: Blackbeard's Trove
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Winding caverns have been carved away over the eons by white washes of waves which funnel into the depths. A stone bridge spans the small stream which now meanders ever deeper and large stone chambers holds the trove of the great pirate king Blackbeard. Something foul lairs in the darkened pool of water guarding this hoard however, ever watchful.

boardgame.name: Underdark Abyss
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Winding caverns have been carved away over the eons by tricking rivulets which funnel into the depths. These forces in combination with the denizens have transformed this underworld into a place of endless ravines and abyssal halls.

Stone bridges span the voids which now are common and large stone chambers hold lairs for the foul entities that call this place home.

boardgame.name: Ravenswood Ravine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Winding ravines have been carved away over the eons by tricking rivulets which funnel into the depths. Debris and muddy grounds have coalesced here with the broken bones of creatures that have succumbed to these fetid grounds.

Stone bridges span the small streams which now meander through this dying forest which hides lairs for the foul entities that call this place home.

boardgame.name: Underdark Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Winding caverns have been carved away over the eons by tricking rivulets which funnel into the depths. Debris and muddy grounds have coalesced here with the broken bones of creatures not suited to this dark place.

Stone bridges span the small streams which now meander ever deeper and large stone chambers hold lairs for the foul entities that call this place home.

boardgame.name: Of the Rakuli
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In ancient times the bizarre world of Barnaynia was ruled by the Rakuli, the Great Old Ones, a strange species of incredible physical and magical power!
For tens of thousands, perhaps millions of years they ruled the world and every race was a slave to their whims. Using strange magic and odd personal ambitions they created many of the strange species that inhabit the dark places of the world. They were almost godlike in their powers and appearance - NOTHING could stand against them.

And then, 90,000 years ago they just disappeared...
Their great constructions became silent and fell into disuse. Creatures that once ran from them came to occupy their empty cities above and below ground. The fantastic structures of this greatest of all civilisation fell into ruins and dust. The creatures themselves passed from living knowledge. The Rakuli became a memory, then a legend, then a myth and then nothing...

These days there are few that have ever heard of the Great Old Ones, fewer still that have heard of the Rakuli. Learned scribes argue over the legitimacy of any trace of their ancient culture. Their artistic relics and magical items are often misappropriated by lesser species. They have passed into the mists of irrelevance.

So what were they? What happened to them?
And why are adventurers returning from the deep Darkworld telling tales of powerful entities and carrying strange and powerful items they have stolen from these new foes?

This book includes everything you could want to know about the mysterious Rakuli, including their history, society, artefacts and powers. There are adventure hooks and explanations of tactics, attitudes and strategies.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Monopoly: La Louvière – Cité des Loups
boardgame.description:
A Monopoly dedicated to the City of La Louvière in Belgium.

Made for part of the 150th anniversary of the city of Wolves.

There was a first run of 1500 and a second run of 1000.


En vous procurant l’incontournable jeu de plateau, vous pourrez arpenter les rues de la Cité des Loups et même y côtoyer la RAAL au cours de parties endiablées.

boardgame.name: Finished! by Friedemann Friese
boardgame.description: App version of Finished! by Friedemann Friese.

boardgame.name: Spaceships 3 - Bioships
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need a ship that you would only touch with a 10 foot pole? I can help! Goes great with my other spaceships. Intended for virtual tabletops.

boardgame.name: Path of Destruction
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tracking a great beastie through the forest as it leaves a path of destruction in its wake? I can help! Goes great with other Critical Trail sets.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Mouscron – Cité des Hurlus
boardgame.description:
The Mouscronnoise edition does not present streets with prestigious names but local businesses or organizations well known to Mouscronnois.

Walk in the city of Mouscron through the original drawings of Monopoly Mouscron, city of Hurlus designed by Jean Marc Krings.

Only 1500 copies made.


Venez vous promener dans la ville de Mouscron au travers des dessins originaux du Monopoly Mouscron.

L’édition mouscronnoise ne présente pas de rues aux noms prestigieux mais des commerces locaux ou des organisations très connus des Mouscronnois.

boardgame.name: High-Rise
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of living in buildings that barely go over your hips? You won’t have that problem with this building. Goes great with other City so Gritty sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Hell Lake
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Players in hell again? Players also notable anglers? Wild. On an unrelated note this set allows you to create giant bodies of “water” in hell. Goes great with other Hell in a Handbasket sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Forest Cliff Trails
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to race along a rocky ledge through the forest pursued by some supernatural terror? I got you covered. Goes great with other Critical Trail sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Desert Town
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A selection of placable buildings allow you to construct you own village. Buildings come

Various mud brick buildings as well as a small assortment of other pieces for an arid slap-down town

This city is not necessarily empty, that would make it a deserted town not a desert town. Set includes various non-directionally sensitive buildings and other pieces to be used to construct an arid town or village. Intended for virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Giant Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

8 multi-section (mostly 2) cave maps created at 30x30 per section.

Need a larger venue for your cave singers? I got you covered. Caves can be used by themselves or linked together to form sprawling cavern complexes. Goes great with my other Save Vs. Cave sets. Intended for virtual tabletops.

boardgame.name: Mushroom Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Seven large (30x30) and Eight small (15x15) mushroom filled cavern maps

Use them on their own of fit them together to form a sprawling mushroom cavern complex. Goes great with other Save Vs. Cave sets. Intended for virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Tree Houses 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

6 30x30 Multi-story sections of modular tree house city

Wood elf on a book shelf? I got some massive trees with houses for your silvan settlements. Goes great with other Critical Trail sets. especially my previous tree houses. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Marble Mapper Water Addition
White Marble Mapper Water Addition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Various tunnels and other watery features to add to Vile Tiles: White Marble Mapper.

Add some watery goodness to your White Marble Mapper creations. Reach out and drown someone!

Intended for virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Under Life
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to add some life to your maps? Be it under sea or under the earth anywhere strange creatures live you’ll find a couple dozen unique varieties to help populate your creations with. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Filling in the Blanks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Filling in the Blanks is a guide to populating hexes with lairs and features to use in fantasy role-playing games. While written specifically for Necrotic Gnome's Old School Essentials it is compatible with virtually all OSR-style games, and can be used with more modern versions of the game with little effort.

It provides tables for randomly generating the number and type of lairs and features that can be found while exploring the wilderness and guidance on how to craft the results into coherent setting details.

boardgame.name: Burakito
boardgame.description:
Burakito is the gateway to the world of Buraco.
It consists of three different levels so that the little ones learn to play gradually until they can have a game of Buraco with their parents and friends.

The game consists of placing tiles on the game board to form sets of neighboring animals, both of the same number and in consecutive numbers.

Every time a player forms a set, she obtains a victory point. If during her move she forms two sets at the same time, she obtains one point for each set.

When all the tiles have been placed on the board, the player who has obtained the most victory points throughout the game wins.

There is a variant to play with special tiles that allow actions such as stealing from an opponent, playing twice in a row or skipping an opponent.

boardgame.name: The Fate of Inglemia (Fate)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Strategic Campaign outline features a Very High Magic setting for Very High Level characters. It is designed to allow the characters to alter events on a world shattering level. Incorporating elements of the Elemental Dimension of Magic, Inglemia goes back to the Prime Material roots of the eternal conflict between the Jeshatan and the magic hating Knah'tan.

Includes: 197 Spells, 45 NPC Templates, 11 Exotic Materials, 20+ Unique Devices, 7 Gods, 26 Unique Aspects, 20 Noble Houses, 10 Secret Societies, 12 Kingdoms, Self Replicating Runes, Mirror Tubes, and 5 Strategic Session Summaries!

Batteries not included.

A complete Fate 3.0 rpg such as Spirit of the Century or the Dresden Files is recommended for use with this product. While it contains a magic system, it does not contain the full Fate 3.0 rules set.

boardgame.name: Zombies!!!: Battle Royale Promo Card
boardgame.description:
All players roll a die. The losers must spend life or bullet tokens to meet or beat the winner's die roll.

Available at Essen 2012 and 2013.

boardgame.name: The Medieval Expansion (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
The Medieval Expansion collects together four fan-made expansions that adds excitement to a city. Each of these expansions may be added to the game of Carcassonne separately, or they may be added together. They are all developed by Jonathan Warren and consist of:


Jousting Tournament, which creates an additional scoring area in a city
The Orders of Chivalry, which allows a knight to be added to a city unconventionally
In the Stocks, which allows a knight to be removed from a city temporarily
The Gallows, which removes a knight from the city permanently
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: In the Stocks (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
The Orders of Chivalry (fan expansion for Carcassonne)

boardgame.name: Adventure Game Starter Set: Woman Warrior
boardgame.description:
Box blurb:

"ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SETS are a complete introduction to the hobby of Fantasy Adventure Gaming, all in one box. Each ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SET contains ten paintable plastic action figures in the standard 25mm size, a set of non-toxic water-based paints with instructions and brush, and a complete set of fast, playable rules for playing out your own fantasy adventures. Even the gaming die is included. (For two or more players, ages 10 and up)."

Each contains two leaflets, one containing the rules and adventure; the other, a painting guide for the miniatures. Though each game has a unique background story and series of encounters, the rules of play are identical. On the last page of the rules leaflet is a promotion for Heritage's soon-to-be-released (at that time) RPG, Swordbearer.

Gameplay consists of running two characters through a series of four encounters (combats). Each side in a combat takes turns. During a turn, all characters on the active side fight, then all characters on the active side may use magic, pick up or throw things, or run away.

Fighting is resolved by cross-indexing the roll of a six-sided die with the letter code of the attacker's weapon (A, B, C or D) on a table corresponding to the defender's armor (which may be light, medium, or heavy) in order to find how much damage, if any, was done to the defender.

The miniatures aren't necessary to play, and aren't even mentioned in the game rules.

The Woman Warrior - "the adventures of a young woman warrior and her friend as they do battle with Bandits, Kobolds (small fierce dog like creatures), giant Bugbears, and a huge fearsome Ogre, in a quest for treasure and glory."
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Adventure Game Starter Sets (Heritage USA)

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 Apocalypse (Collector's Edition)
boardgame.description:
Warhammer 40,000 Apocalypse Collector's Edition comes with every single item necessary to run games of Apocalypse and includes:

A faux, green leather Rule Book.
A copy of Pluvian's Fighting Formations (WWII style format)
A full set of index cards for every army available at the time of publication (Factory Sealed)
Warzone Pandorax and Armageddon, both in a hand-stitched, field-manual format.
A full deck of Armageddon Cards (Factory Sealed)
A fold-out game stat screen that doubles as a litho, featuring the legions of Chaos (art-work scan pictured)


The Collector's box itself is a veritable work of art itself. With a faux inlaid wood exterior, featuring iconography of the Holy Imperium.


A gray and black leather faux wood display boxed version of the rules for 40K Apocalypse 6th edition limited to 1500 copies. The rules themselves are in a smaller print bound in a green leather. Multiple other contents therein as well for reference and cards.

boardgame.name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Borgo with alternative graphics
boardgame.description: This the army from the base game with unique graphics. It was the award for the winner of Neuroshima Hex Championship eliminations in Poland in 2018.

listing.notes:
Since the beginning of the war, Moloch has created numerous generations of mutants. Enhanced growth rate, genetic engineering and high combat skills are the essence of a mutant’s abilities. Their various breeds roam the barren lands fighting over every inch of it, quite often against one another. The scattered groups have finally become united by the charismatic cyber-mutant Borgo, who leads the horde against humanity under his defiling banner of Biohazard.
This exclusive promo army has unique graphics. It was the award for the winner of Neuroshima Hex Championship eliminations in Poland in 2018.

boardgame.name: Cavernicoli
Prehistorias
Prehistories
boardgame.description:
You are the leader of a prehistoric tribe, deciding which members of your tribe go hunting and what prey they want to catch. To guide you, the Elders have created challenges that you can complete by painting on the wall of your cave.

Each round in Prehistories, you and your fellow tribe leaders bid simultaneously (and secretly) to decide who hunts where. The more hunters you have, the bigger the game you can catch, but the slower you are. The fastest player — that is, the one with the smallest sum of hunters — goes first, but they have few hunters with which to hunt. To hunt, you assign your hunters to one or more locations to catch the prey waiting there. Prey is represented by polyomino tiles, and the larger the tile, the higher the sum required. If you have just enough hunters to catch your prey, they might be wounded in the process, which means you'll draw fewer hunter cards at the end of the round to refill your hand. (They distrust your leadership when you get them injured!)

In the second phase of a round, you paint your cave with the animal tiles collected during the hunting phase. Your cave is represented by a 7x7 grid that starts with a few tiles already in place. The first tile you place goes in the left-hand column, and all subsequent tiles must touch tiles already placed, with all tiles being oriented so that the animals are viewed with their legs (or fins) down. (Cavemen have simple tastes and want everything to be representational.)

When you fulfill the wishes of the Elders by painting your cave in certain ways — such as completing a horizontal line or connecting opposing corners or surrounding a legendary animal on all sides — you place one or more totem tokens on that challenge. Whoever first discards their eight totem tokens wins.

boardgame.name: Hot Potato!
boardgame.description:
What challenges will your potatoes encounter?!

In Hot Potato! you will use one of your six potatoes to best deal with encounters. Your Sweet Potato is a good match against a Vicious Virus, and the Rambotato will surely defeat a Furious Fryer, but both would suffer in an encounter with a Wicked Weed. You play quick and easy rounds that consist of four steps:


Play a Potato card face down and simultaneously reveal it.
Draw the encounter card.
Deal with the encounter and see who wins a point.
Use potato effects. These effects can be used only by the 'loser(s)' of the round and are generally an advantage for the next round. But be careful, if Rambotato fired the Hot Potato at you, you cannot use any effects!


The first player to make it to 10 points wins.

-description from publisher

listing.notes: Title: Hot Potato! Publisher: Jolly Dutch Productions Language(s): English German French Dutch

boardgame.name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Hegemony with alternative graphics
boardgame.description: This the army from the base game with unique graphics. It was the award for the winner of Neuroshima Hex Championship eliminations in Poland in 2019.

boardgame.name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Moloch with alternative graphics
boardgame.description: This the army from the base game with unique graphics. It was the award during Polish Neuroshima Hex Championship 2019 finals in January 2020.

boardgame.name: Nile Artifacts
boardgame.description:
Welcome, traveler, to the ancient waters of the Nile! As many new temples are built on the shores, you begin your spiritual journey to earn the favors of the Gods. Pick up precious artifacts while you sail up and down the Nile river, offer them to the monuments currently being built, and the Gods shall bless your travel!

Each turn in Nile Artifacts, you move your ship forward, stopping at one of the nine ports and picking up one of the artifact cards available there. You may also pick up gold, which can be used to obtain more artifacts or to turn your ship around and sail the Nile in the opposite direction. Once every ship has arrived at one end of the Nile, players can make their offerings to the monuments currently in construction, each of them requiring a different type or combination of artifacts. Whenever a monument is completed, players receive victory points depending on the amount of donations they have made towards this particular monument.

When offerings are done, the ships go back on the Nile to travel in the other direction and pick up more artifacts. Once the monument deck is empty, the player with the most victory points wins!

—description from publisher

listing.notes:
Spieler: 2 - 4 Sprache: DE, EN, FR Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Alter: 8 +
Nile Artifacts Ich bin Horus von Jahrmillionen! Ich sende die Glut meiner Strahlen, damit dein Herzen zu mir findet – Altägyptischer Text
Steuere deine Barke über den Nil und beweise deine Hingabe an die Götter mit dem Bau eines prächtigen Monuments. Statte den Tempel mit wunderschönen Artefakten aus, die du in den neun Häfen auf dem Spielplan entdecken kannst. In jeder Runde bestimmst du den Kurs und steuerst dein Schiff. Errichte das höchste Gebäude und sammle dadurch Gunstpunkte. Lege deine prächtige Schätze vor Hors, Isis und Osiris nieder und gewinne das Spiel! Einfache Regeln, eine spannende Schatzsuche und vollfarbige Karten sorgen jeden Abend für ein ambientiges Spielvergnügen. Damit ist Nile Artifacts das perfekte Familienspiel mit Kindern ab dem Grundschulalter.
In Nile Artifacts segelst du zur Zeit der Pharaonen über Nil und sammelst heilige Artefakte. Mit ihnen willst du die Gunst der ägyptischen Gottheiten erlangen. Wie erfolgreich wird deine Suche sein und wie prächtig dein Monument?
Inhalt: • 1 Nil-Spielbrett • 1 Gunstpunkte-Tafel • 54 Artefaktkarten • 18 Monumentkarten • 30 Münzen • 1 Startspielermarke • 4 Schiffe • 20 Gläubige • 4 Spielermarken • 4 Punktemarken • Spielregeln (DE, EN, FR)
Achtung! Nicht für Kinder unter 3 Jahren geeignet. Verschluckbare Kleinteile. Erstickungsgefahr!

boardgame.name: DM Yourself
boardgame.description:
A guide and set of rules for how to play existing Dungeons & Dragons Fifth Edition (D&D5e) adventures/campaigns (such as The Lost Mines of Phandelver or The Dragon of Icespire Peak) solo with a single character, as close to the way they are written as possible.

The aim is to allow players to enjoy these adventures solo with the minimum of preparation, work or additional rules, and maximum immersion.

boardgame.name: The Procession to Calvary
boardgame.description:
Pythonesque adventure game in which you journey through a richly detailed landscape built from hundreds of Renaissance paintings.

Huzzah! The holy war is over! Your oppressors have been vanquished, the churches of the Old God lay in ruin and thousands of innocent people have been murdered! But it's not all good news; the tyrant Heavenly Peter has escaped your clutches, and you have been tasked with finding him…

boardgame.name: Wald der Lichter
boardgame.description:
It's become very dark in the forest of lights because the dwarven treasure was stolen by the evil Griswald. This treasure is not just any treasure, but something very special because it's the only things that can make the forest shine. On the run, Griswald has hidden the treasures in the forest and cast a spell on them: Only if the treasures are returned in the correct order will the magic break and the forest shine again.

In Wald der Lichter ("Forest of Lights"), Ethelred the Seventh, King of the Dwarves, has sent you to find the individual treasures, so make careful note of where they're hidden so that you can bring them back to the king.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Graf Ludo Best Children's Game Graphics Nominee

Drei Magier®: Wald der Lichter Im Lichterwald ist es dunkel geworden, denn der Wichtelschatz wurde vom bösen Gunthart gestohlen. Dieser Schatz ist nicht irgendein Schatz, er ist etwas ganz Besonderes. Denn nur er bringt den Wald zum Leuchten. Auf der Flucht hat Gunthart die Schätze im Wald versteckt und sie mit einem Zauber belegt: Nur, wenn die Schätze in der richtigen Reihenfolge zurückgebracht werden, bricht der Zauber und der Wald kann wieder leuchten. Der Wichtelkönig Fridolin der 7te hat euch geschickt, um die einzelnen Schätze zu finden. Merkt euch also gut, wo die Schätze versteckt sind, damit ihr sie dem König zurückbringen könnt. Er wird euch sehr dankbar sein.

boardgame.name: The Black Hack Classic Monsters
boardgame.description:
From the Preface:

Classic Monsters is a supplement aimed at giving Black Hack GMs rules for a wide range of monsters. The monsters have been selected from B/X and First Edition rules of The World's Most Popular Fantasy Role-playing Game. This makes Classic Monsters particulary handy for GMs who wish to run adventures written for those early games and their many clones.
